revised_title: Fossil Mammals of Australia: The Genus Nototherium
tldr: This article discusses the fossil mammals of Australia, specifically the genus Nototherium, which is a large extinct Marsupial herbivore. The author, Prof. R. Owen, describes the differences between Nototherium and Diprotodon, focusing on the unique modifications of the cranium of Nototherium. The paper includes a detailed analysis of the mandible and dentition, as well as comparisons with other related species. The author also provides a table of localities where fossils of Nototherium have been found.
